title: ESET PROTECT
descriptionMarkdown: This connector gathers all events generated by ESET software through the central management solution ESET PROTECT (formerly ESET Security Management Center). This includes Anti-Virus detections, Firewall detections but also more advanced EDR detections. For a complete list of events please refer to [the documentation](https://help.eset.com/protect_admin/latest/en-US/events-exported-to-json-format.html).
additionalRequirementBanner: These queries are dependent on a parser based on a Kusto Function deployed as part of the solution.

sampleQueries.query:
ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| summarize ThreatCount = count() by tostring(ThreatName)
| top 10 by ThreatCount

ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'FirewallAggregated_Event'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

sampleQueries.description: ESET threat events from Real-time file system protection
sampleQueries.query:
ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| where ScanId == 'Real-time file system protection'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

sampleQueries.description: Query ESET threat events from On-demand scanner
sampleQueries.query:
ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| where ScanId == 'On-demand scanner'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

sampleQueries.description: Top hosts by number of threat events
sampleQueries.query:
ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Threat_Event'
| summarize threat_events_count = count() by HostName
| sort by threat_events_count desc

ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'FilteredWebsites_Event'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

ESETPROTECT
| where EventType == 'Audit_Event'
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

dataTypes.name: Syslog (ESETPROTECT)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ESETPROTECT
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

value:
ESETPROTECT
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
| project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: **NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected which is deployed as part of the solution. To view the function code in Log Analytics, open Log Analytics/Microsoft Sentinel Logs blade, click Functions and search for the alias ESETPROTECT and load the function code or click [here](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/ESETPROTECT/Parsers/ESETPROTECT.txt).The function usually takes 10-15 minutes to activate after solution installation/update.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux
instructionSteps.description:
Typically, you should install the agent on a different computer from the one on which the logs are generated.

>  Syslog logs are collected only from **Linux** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities. The default ESET PROTECT facility is **user**.
3.  Click **Save**.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure ESET PROTECT
instructionSteps.description:
Configure ESET PROTECT to send all events through Syslog.

1.  Follow [these instructions](https://help.eset.com/protect_admin/latest/en-US/admin_server_settings_syslog.html) to configure syslog output. Make sure to select **BSD** as the format and **TCP** as the transport.

2.  Follow [these instructions](https://help.eset.com/protect_admin/latest/en-US/admin_server_settings_export_to_syslog.html) to export all logs to syslog. Select **JSON** as the output format.

Note:- Refer to the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/connect-log-forwarder?tabs=rsyslog#security-considerations) for setting up the log forwarder for both local and cloud storage.
